description: A Logia-type Devil Fruit that allows the user to create, control, and transform into mud/swamp at will, making the user a Swamp Human. The user can create bottomless swamps that are impossible to escape from and has infinite storage space within their body.

users.circumstances: Caribou had already eaten the fruit before his debut in Episode 521

abilityReveals.description: Like most Logia users, Caribou cannot be hit or sliced as his mud element is intangible. Attacks pass through his swamp body harmlessly.
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: A Marine attempts to attack Caribou with a sword but the blade passes through his swamp body.

abilityReveals.description: Caribou can create bottomless swamps that trap and smother opponents. Those caught in the swamp will sink deeper if they struggle.
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: Caribou uses his swamp powers to smother a Marine before shooting him.

abilityReveals.description: The fruit grants the user infinite space within their body, allowing Caribou to store weapons, objects, and even people inside himself.
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: Implied by the nature of his powers demonstrated in this episode, though fully shown in later episodes.

weaknesses.weakness: Standard Devil Fruit weakness - inability to swim and weakness to seawater
User cannot transform back to normal form if confined in a space that their normal body cannot fit in
Limited offensive capabilities beyond drowning opponents
Vulnerable to water manipulators who can exploit the swamp nature

strengths.strength: As a Logia, provides near-invulnerability against non-Haki attacks
strengths.description: The user's swamp body cannot be harmed by conventional weapons.

strengths.strength: Infinite storage capacity within the user's body
strengths.description: Can store unlimited weapons, treasures, and even captured people.

strengths.strength: Swamps are inescapable traps that drown opponents
strengths.description: Opponents sink deeper when they struggle, making escape nearly impossible.
